p: A logistic regression was also carried out in the same way, for the purposes of comparison, the results of which are shown in Table 4. A percentage of 63.6% of hits was found in the containers that did not have any Aedes aegypti pupae (specificity) and 71.7% in the containers with Aedes aegypti pupae (sensitivity), with accuracy of 64.1%. Thus, the capacity for predicting the presence of Aedes aegypti pupae of this method was found to be inferior to the method proposed in this study. Considering the prevalence of containers with Aedes aegypti pupae of 6.3%, the negative predictive value of the logistic regression was 97.1% and the positive predictive value was 11.7%.
